cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles east of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow and turn north, then northeast after landfall, tracking inland across Alabama and central Georgia toward the coastal Carolinas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Mississippi-Alabama border (around Biloxi, MS)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch and Storm-Surge Watch remain confined to the north-central Gulf Coast (Port Fourchon LA eastward to the Walton/Okaloosa County line FL).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Morgan City LA to Navarre FL; Tropical-Storm Warning east of Navarre to Indian Pass FL; Storm-Surge Warning Port Fourchon LA to Walton/Okaloosa County line FL.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact zone along the north-central Gulf Coast with inland effects spreading across MS, AL, GA, and the western Carolinas.
weather_observation.wind: Only a low (≤7%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible late Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected on the Georgia coast; any rise likely below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential 4–8 inches of rain as the remnant center passes inland across Georgia, producing localized flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out in outer rain bands late Thursday into Friday; hazardous seas and rip currents expected along the Georgia coast.
